name: n-benzoylbenzamide
Reason: 1,2-diphenylethanol, the base unit, has a melting point around 106°C. The introduction of a benzamide group (–CO–NH–) adds rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C. The benzene ring in the base unit contributes to the melting point due to its planarity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The methyl group introduces a small increase in molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5°C.
